parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To throw violently on the ground. From sun and sparasso; to rend completely, i.e. to convulse violently.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To roll, roll along, wallow. From the base of kuma; to roll about.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To foam (at the mouth), froth. From aphros; to froth at the mouth.
